intro: Asperula friabilis, commonly known as the fragrant woodbine, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, fragrant white or pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Asperula friabilis is typically found in woodland areas and thrives in partial shade with well-drained soil.
